results.title: The Edge of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Saskia Baron, Shana Swanson, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “American cinema”.
While many of the old rules are still in force, independent filmmakers often add their dissineting voices to the forum. This program looks at some alternative visions from new talents including Spike Lee, Joel and Ethan Coen, Jim Jarmusch and Quentin Tarantino. With limited budgets, they are challenging the stylistic status quo of the Hollywood film.

results.title: The Edge of forever
results.creator_credit: Adrian Malone, David F. Oyster, Gregory Andorfer, Polytel International, BBC Film Unit, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
What is the origin of the universe? What is its fate? Will it continue to expand forever, or someday collapse upon itself? Carl Sagan explores the time when stars and galaxies began to form, and shows how, in this century, humans discovered the expansion of the universe. He also explores the philosophical and religious questions that these musings create. Topics discussed along the way include galaxies and their many different forms, the Doppler effect, tessaracts, the Big Bang and quasars.

results.title: The Ed Sullivan Show
results.creator_credit: Susan F. Walker, Bob Precht and Chester Feldman
results.brief_description: The Ed Sullivan Show is an American TV variety show that originally ran on CBS from Sunday June 20, 1948 to Sunday June 6, 1971, and was hosted by New York entertainment columnist Ed Sullivan.

constellations_other.name: Viral music videos
constellations_other.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan F. Walker, Bob Precht and Chester Feldman
results.description:
The Ed Sullivan Show is an American TV variety show that originally ran on CBS from Sunday June 20, 1948 to Sunday June 6, 1971, and was hosted by New York entertainment columnist Ed Sullivan. It was replaced in September 1971 by the CBS Sunday Night Movie, which ran only one season and was eventually replaced by other shows.

In 2002, The Ed Sullivan Show was ranked #15 on TV Guide’s 50 Greatest TV Shows of All Time.
description_for_label:
The Ed Sullivan Show is an American TV variety show that originally ran on CBS from Sunday June 20, 1948 to Sunday June 6, 1971, and was hosted by New York entertainment columnist Ed Sullivan. It was replaced in September 1971 by the CBS Sunday Night Movie, which ran only one season and was eventually replaced by other shows.

In 2002, The Ed Sullivan Show was ranked #15 on TV Guide’s 50 Greatest TV Shows of All Time.

results.title: The Ecology of development
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Factors such as biological inheritance, temperament, caregiving, family, peers, schooling, culture and history are introduced. Four levels of the environment are defined and illustrated: microsystem, mesosystem, exosystem and macrosystem. We meet twelve families from five countries whose lives we share throughout the series.

results.title: The Ecology of agriculture
results.creator_credit: Agricultural Council of Denmark and Naturfoto
results.brief_description: Aims to promote the use of various agricultural methods which emphasise the scientific approach. Notes the importance of nutrients in the soil: the damage caused by mildew and pests; the need for the use of sprays; the damage caused by excessive spraying; and the development of strains of pests resistant to sprays.

results.title: The Eclipse = L'eclisse
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim, Paris Film Productions and Interopa Film - Cineriz
results.brief_description: This, the third in Antonioni’s “cycle of sentiments”, begins with the break up of Vittoria (Monica Vitti) and her partner Riccardo. The film then follows Vittoria and Piero (Alain Delon) while a love affair is cautiously entered into. At times using plot and dialogue to spell out the themes, for the most part the confusion of the characters is suggested more carefully by the film’s surfaces, both in its use of composition and in the soundtrack. There are also intense concentrations on the surfaces and the figures that create character, but these are often diminished by reframing or set in tension with the solid forms of the architecture. ‘L’eclisse’ is preoccupied with immateriality and it is by way of edging away from any clear definition that it maintains a distinctly ‘modern’ air. Italian language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michelangelo Antonioni, Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim, Paris Film Productions and Interopa Film - Cineriz

results.title: The Echinoderms (TEFC): starfish, brittle stars, sea urchins, sea cucumbers
results.brief_description: Looks at the tide pool animals the echinoderms which share their evolutionary limbs with our own phylum. The segments introduce sea stars, brittle stars, basket stars, sea urchins, sand dollars and sea cucumbers.

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.
